http.server

Class WebServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • http.server.WebServlet

  • public class WebServlet
extends java.lang.Object
    web servlet sending responses according to different requests

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fillHeaders(java.lang.String oneLine)
      notes all header information in one request into the HashMap, normally only the Content-Length might be used in this server, but for possible extension, all headers are marked
      int getContentLength()
      indicates the Content-Length of the body of one request, usually used for POST and PUT requests for writing files.
      java.lang.String getLocalResourceFileName(java.lang.StringBuffer stringBuffer)
      reads a desired file name from a POST, DELETE or PUT request, if the desired file name already exists in the local folder, the new file will replace the local existing one if the user is allowed to do this
      static java.lang.String getRequestType(java.lang.StringBuffer stringBuffer)
      reads the request type from the request text, currently support HRAD, GET, POST, DELETE, PUT, if the request is of a type that is not supported, the default value is an empty request which will later be ignored.
      java.lang.String getResourceFileName(java.lang.StringBuffer stringBuffer)
      reads a requested local existing file name from the request String that is in the resources folder.
      static java.lang.String header(java.lang.String resourceURI, long length, java.lang.String status)
      writes the header text for a response depending on the given parameters, currently support limited file type: text/html, video/mp4, image/png, image/jpg, audio/mp3, video/avi, application/pdf, the default file type is text/html
      void httpDELETE(java.lang.String resourceURI)
      the method that handles the DELETE requests, which deletes a local resource file deleting critical files is forbidden.
      void httpGET(java.lang.String resourceURI)
      the method that handles the GET requests, which can have a lot of functionalities, currently have 200, 404, 500 responses.
      void httpHEAD(java.lang.String resourceURI)
      the method that handles HEAD requests, currently have 200, 404 responses.
      void httpPOST(byte[] body, java.lang.String resourceURI)
      the method that handles the POST requests, which appends or creates a file.
      void httpPUT(byte[] body, java.lang.String resourceURI)
      the method that handles the PUT requests, which replaces or creates a file.
      static java.lang.String internalErrorMsg()
      writes the body text for a 500 response

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • fillHeaders

        public void fillHeaders(java.lang.String oneLine)
        notes all header information in one request into the HashMap, normally only the Content-Length might be used in this server, but for possible extension, all headers are marked
        Parameters:
        oneLine - one line of the request

      • getContentLength

        public int getContentLength()
        indicates the Content-Length of the body of one request, usually used for POST and PUT requests for writing files. If there isn't such a header noted in the HashMap of headers, this function will return 0 as a default value.
        Returns:
        the Content-Length of a request body if there is one

      • getResourceFileName

        public java.lang.String getResourceFileName(java.lang.StringBuffer stringBuffer)
        reads a requested local existing file name from the request String that is in the resources folder. returns empty String as default value, which will later give the index page.
        Parameters:
        stringBuffer - the request text
        Returns:
        the file name which can be found in the resources folder

      • getLocalResourceFileName

        public java.lang.String getLocalResourceFileName(java.lang.StringBuffer stringBuffer)
        reads a desired file name from a POST, DELETE or PUT request, if the desired file name already exists in the local folder, the new file will replace the local existing one if the user is allowed to do this
        Parameters:
        stringBuffer - the request text
        Returns:
        the desired file name to be stored in the server

      • getRequestType

        public static java.lang.String getRequestType(java.lang.StringBuffer stringBuffer)
        reads the request type from the request text, currently support HRAD, GET, POST, DELETE, PUT, if the request is of a type that is not supported, the default value is an empty request which will later be ignored.
        Parameters:
        stringBuffer - the request text
        Returns:
        the request type

      • header

        public static java.lang.String header(java.lang.String resourceURI,
                                      long length,
                                      java.lang.String status)
        writes the header text for a response depending on the given parameters, currently support limited file type: text/html, video/mp4, image/png, image/jpg, audio/mp3, video/avi, application/pdf, the default file type is text/html
        Parameters:
        resourceURI - the resource URI name
        length - the size of the file
        status - the status code of the response
        Returns:
        a text of the header

      • internalErrorMsg

        public static java.lang.String internalErrorMsg()
        writes the body text for a 500 response
        Returns:
        the 500 body text

      • httpGET

        public void httpGET(java.lang.String resourceURI)
             throws java.io.IOException
        the method that handles the GET requests, which can have a lot of functionalities, currently have 200, 404, 500 responses. One special resource for the GET request is that it allows the user to start a UDP tunnel at the server side and then communicate with it through UDP multicast
        Parameters:
        resourceURI - the desired resource file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception for IO errors when writing output stream

      • httpDELETE

        public void httpDELETE(java.lang.String resourceURI)
                throws java.io.IOException
        the method that handles the DELETE requests, which deletes a local resource file deleting critical files is forbidden. currently have 200, 403, 404, 500 responses. the 200 response will return the index page, which means that the delete was successful
        Parameters:
        resourceURI - the desired resource file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception for IO errors when writing output stream

      • httpPUT

        public void httpPUT(byte[] body,
                    java.lang.String resourceURI)
             throws java.io.IOException
        the method that handles the PUT requests, which replaces or creates a file. replacing critical files is forbidden. the put requests are mostly dedicated for uploading resources, currently have 200, 201, 403, 500 responses. the 200, 201 responses will return the result of the post request
        Parameters:
        body - the binary body code of a file from the request
        resourceURI - the desired resource file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception for IO errors when writing output stream

      • httpPOST

        public void httpPOST(byte[] body,
                     java.lang.String resourceURI)
              throws java.io.IOException
        the method that handles the POST requests, which appends or creates a file. appending to critical files is forbidden. though post requests can be really variable, here due to a lack of dynamic resources, only post files are possible. currently have 200, 201, 403, 500 responses. the 200, 201 responses will return the result of the post request
        Parameters:
        body - the binary body code of a file from the request
        resourceURI - the desired file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception when handling output stream

      • httpHEAD

        public void httpHEAD(java.lang.String resourceURI)
              throws java.io.IOException
        the method that handles HEAD requests, currently have 200, 404 responses.
        Parameters:
        resourceURI - the requested file URI
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - exception of IO when writing the output stream
